hook.text: Johnson & Johnson recalled 31 million bottles of Tylenol in 1982. Their honesty saved the brand.

buildup.text: In a crisis, silence breeds rumors. Slow responses breed distrust. Speed and honesty win.

discovery.text: Crisis communication formula: acknowledge fast, share what you know, commit to updates.

twist.text: Trying to spin a crisis always backfires. People forgive mistakes but not cover-ups.

climax.text: Be first, be right, be credible. That's the CDC's crisis communication mantra.

punchline.text: In a crisis, speed and honesty beat polish.

quiz.question: What is the key principle of effective crisis communication?
options: Acknowledge quickly, share what you know, and commit to updates
Wait until you have all the facts before saying anything
Control the narrative by sharing only positive information
